comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content: What a fantastic pair of monuments, any idea where exactly they are?

comment.author: 73359068@N00
comment._content: This is the Kirkham Chantry at Paignton. Must be some sort of record, me knowing something that Churchcrawler didn't! ;-)

comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content: Great work there, thanks so much for identifying this one at last :-) I can feel a trip to Devon coming on at some stage. (I hope Phil's not feeling too red faced, perhaps CC is human afterall LOL ;-)

comment.author: 73359068@N00
comment._content: Human??? Phil?? Never.  ;-) Good job I know him! I have to confess I didn't actually know it beforehand. I searched Google images with the words gothic chantry tombs. It popped up on about page 5. That technique's often effective if there's something distinctive about the image to search on.

comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content: LOL, the great man is a shade above us ordinary mere mortals isn't he! ;-) I had a quick search for this a while back but to no avail, it does seem somewhat under represented online (next to nothing from this church on Flickr); Ironically I seem to remember reading there was something good here years ago, but had long forgotten the place when wracking my brain for potential locations..

comment.author: 22413548@N00
comment._content: After a prompt by Andy I have returned here to see where they are (as I had not commented but just received the link from Aidan I didn't see automatically!) Of course it is Paignton, but what an unusual photograph. Most people including BoE take the tombs from the other side. However this view makes them seem even more impressive. I am most definitely human - been at a low ebb of late, I know I shouldn't let footie get to me, but also I am very nervous when it is excessively windy weatherwise.  Also Paignton is somewhere I have not (yet) set foot in ever, or even driven through. Bloody hell this list of "must-sees" is growing.

comment.author: 73359068@N00
comment._content: Paignton doesn't exist anyway. I know that because when I was about 7 a teacher asked us for place names beginning with P, and I said Paignton and she said (rather angrily!) no there's no such place. I was very confused because I'd been through it. :-/
